column4: << Need help with .deb installs. I ran "sudo dpkg -i package_file.deb" but I can't find the installation after.
what are you trying to install
where did you get this package ?
sudo apt-get ipheth-utils should get it
you didn't have to download that
it's in the universe repo
I'd recommand getting it from the repo now to make sure you have all the dependencies
not the no-icon issue
I doubt there is an icon/menu item for it in the package
yes I read what it is
you may already have the dependencies
why do you think it's not working
how are you trying to tether it ?
ok - so how are you trying to tether the phone
no, that's just plugging something in, how are you trying to actually tether the device
no, you need to use tethering software, and ipheth will allow your tethering software to use the iphone
ipheth is not the tethering software it's self
I think I see where you are going with that. Perhaps I just didn't understand the functionality. thanks.
try the gnome network manager, it "should" just show you the tethering option now
because you are not sourcing roots environment. 1.) you should not be root 2.) you should not be doing "su" as root, you are already root
ubuntu is built around the sudo model, you should be using it
there is no need for "root" for that
